captions.text:
Arizona, six-year-old Kyle Byrd
is taking batting practice.

-Why do you love
baseball so much?

-Kyle and his twin sister
Lauren were less than a year old

when doctors diagnosed them with
SMA, spinal muscular atrophy,

a severe form of
muscular dystrophy.

-Nothing can really
prepare you for the moment

your children have
a terminal illness.
It was a pretty dark moment.

-It probably took me a
year to come to terms
with what we were dealing with.
I cried every night for a year.

When I would rock them
to sleep at night,

I just remember just
crying, tears falling

on them while I rocking
to sleep and just thankful

that they were too young to
realize their mom's crying.

-Like his twin, Kyle has legs
that are permanently bent.

He cannot lift his head
or roll over in bed.
His arms and lungs are weak.

Many SMA children die
before the age of two.

Yet even as they continue
to face an uncertain future,

He's the son that
I always wanted.

He has gravitated to
sports like as much
as I would have wanted my son.

got engaged at Chase field, Kyle
loves the Arizona Diamondbacks.

I had really no
idea the statistics
that reside in this kid's head.

-Who hits the ball the farthest
on the D-Backs right now?

-Sometimes I have to
ask the tough questions.

-One day, he was
laying in his bed,

and he's got his
D-Back stuffed animal,

and he's got his map of
Chase Field on the wall.

And he looked over at his
map, and he looked back at me,

and he said, I just want to
be a real D-Backs baseball

at Kyle's weekly
Miracle League game.

He has no idea that a few
of his favorite Diamondbacks

Adam, Adam Eaton,
nice to meet you.

That's awesome that
you remember me.

-As Kyle crosses home plate,
Willie Bloomquist has big news.

-Hey, that was a
really good hit.
I have a question for you.
I understand you had a big wish.

-You want to be a real baseball
player for the Diamondbacks?

You'd like to do that and
come be a part of our team?

-Days later, Kyle is
inside Chase Field,

meeting up with
some fellow D-Backs.

-Let's see you
switch up your hand.

-Kyle takes his cuts and
gets some hitting tips.
Get your bottom hand down there.

one of his favorite
pitchers awaits.
You get a question for him?

-Where he gets introduced
to his new teammates.

He's going to be in
our lineup today and be

So I think we should all
give him a nice hand.

-During batting practice,
Kyle works on his pitching.

-Later in front of 24,000
fans, the newest D-Back

-And now, throwing out today's
ceremonial first pitch,

-But for Kyle, nothing feels
better than being a real

title: My Wish: Arizona Diamondbacks Grant Kyle Byrd's Wish

did anyone notice the mom has different color eyes or am i just seeing

comments.author: superficial gamer

comments.text:
+superficial gamer Yes, it's called heterochromia iridum, or being 
"diachromatic". My right eye is brown and my left eye is usually blue. 
Thank you for watching and I hope you enjoyed it.
